title: How to Import Minecraft Skins on Mobile, Make Custom Skins & More

steps.title: Open the Minecraft app and tap Dressing Room.
steps.content: Open the Minecraft app and tap Dressing Room . The app has an icon that resembles a Minecraft dirt block. Once you’re in the app, tap Dressing Room . It's on the right side of the title screen below your Minecraft character. [1] X Research source Minecraft is available for purchase from the Google Play Store on Android or the App Store on iPhone and iPad. If you're not signed in to your Minecraft account, tap Sign In on the left and sign in with the email address and password associated with your Microsoft or Xbox account.

steps.title: Tap < or > to select a character.
steps.content: Tap < or > to select a character. You have a few different characters to choose from. Tap the arrow icons next to your Minecraft character to select a character and start to customize them.. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Create Character to create a custom skin.
steps.content: Tap Create Character to create a custom skin. It's the button directly below your character. When going to edit a character you already made, the button will be Edit Character instead. This opens the Character Creator screen. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Body.
steps.content: Tap Body . Once you’re on the Character Creator screen, tap the Body button on the lower left half of the screen. This displays options you can use to edit your character's body and start to make your custom skin. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap a body part to select it and customize the color.
steps.content: Tap a body part to select it and customize the color. When you see a body part you like, tap it in the menu to the left to select it and add it to your custom character. To select a color for the body part, tap the icon that resembles a paint palette below your character and to the left. Then tap one of the colored swatches to select a color. You can edit the following body parts: Base (skin tone) Hair Eyes Mouth Facial Hair Arms Legs Size

steps.title: Tap < to go back to the previous menu screen.
steps.content: Tap < to go back to the previous menu screen. It's the icon with an arrow pointing left. It's in the upper-left corner.

steps.title: Tap Style.
steps.content: Tap Style . It's the second drop-down menu in the menu to the left. This displays clothing options you can add to your character. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap a clothing option.
steps.content: Tap a clothing option. This displays options for that clothing in the menu to the left. Clothing options are listed in the menu to the left. Tap a clothing option to select it and add it to your custom skin. Clothing options are as follows: Top Bottom Outerwear Headwear Gloves Footwear Face Item Back Item Items with a gold coin icon in the lower-right corner must be purchased with Minecoins. To purchase Minecoins, tap the gold coin icon in the upper-right corner and select a purchase option. Then select a purchase option. Minecoins start at $1.99 for 320 Minecoins.

steps.title: Tap < to go back to the previous menu screen.
steps.content: Tap < to go back to the previous menu screen. It's the icon with an arrow pointing left. It's in the upper-right corner.

steps.title: Tap the green icon that has a hanger.
steps.content: Tap the green icon that has a hanger. It's the third image icon on the left side of the screen. This displays options for changing your skin and skins that you own. They are listed by package and category. Alternatively, you can tap Purchasable to see a list of skins that are available for purchase. Tap a skin to see what package it is part of and how many Minecoins it costs to buy it.

steps.title: Tap the number next to a skin pack to see all skins in that pack.
steps.content: Tap the number next to a skin pack to see all skins in that pack. The menu displays 3 skins from each skin pack in the menu to the left. Tap the icon with plus (+) and a number next to the three skins to see all skins available in that skin pack.

steps.title: Tap a skin to select it.
steps.content: Tap a skin to select it. Your character will wear that skin when you play the game. Tap the back arrow in the upper-right corner to return to the title screen.

steps.title: Open the Google Play Store .
steps.content: Open the Google Play Store . It's the app that has an icon that resembles a colorful triangle.

steps.title: Type Skins for Minecraft PE in the search bar, select the app, and tap Install.
steps.content: Type Skins for Minecraft PE in the search bar, select the app, and tap Install . The search bar is at the top of the Google Play Store, or in the center of the search page on the App Store. This displays a list of apps in the search results. Find Skins for Minecraft PE in the results, tap it, then tap Install . Alternatively, you can download Skinseed .

steps.title: Open Skins for Minecraft PE.
steps.content: Open Skins for Minecraft PE. Tap the icon on your home screen or apps menu to open Skins for Minecraft. You can also tap Open next to the app in the Google Play Store or App Store.

steps.title: Tap < or > to browse skins.
steps.content: Tap < or > to browse skins. There are several pages of skins for you to choose from. Tap < or > to change pages. According to Minecraft Expert Zac Churchill, “Most Minecraft skin websites allow the player to create their own skin through different skin-creation tools and allow the player to choose from many skins created by other Minecraft players.”

steps.title: Tap a skin you like and click Save.
steps.content: Tap a skin you like and click Save . When you see a skin you like, tap on it to display the skin. Then, tap Save in the bottom-center of the screen. It's the button that has an icon that resembles a disk. It's at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Gallery.
steps.content: Tap Gallery . Once you click Save, a pop-up window titled Export Skill will appear. Tap Gallery towards the bottom of the window. This exports the skin to your Gallery as a flat image.

steps.title: Open Minecraft and tap Profile.
steps.content: Open Minecraft and tap Profile . Minecraft on mobile has an icon that resembles a dirt block. Tap the icon on your home screen or apps menu to open Minecraft. Once you’ve opened the app, tap Profile . It's on the right side of the title screen below your Minecraft character. If you're not signed in to your Minecraft account, tap Sign In on the left and sign in with the email address and password associated with your Microsoft or Xbox account.

steps.title: Tap < or > to select a character.
steps.content: Tap < or > to select a character. You have a few different characters to choose from. Tap the arrow icons next to your Minecraft character to select a character.

steps.title: Tap Edit Character.
steps.content: Tap Edit Character . It's the button directly below your character. This opens the Character Editor screen.

steps.title: Tap the green icon with a hanger.
steps.content: Tap the green icon with a hanger. It's the third image icon on the left side of the screen. This displays options for changing your skin and skins that you own.

steps.title: Tap Import.
steps.content: Tap Import . It's the first option at the top of the Minecraft Skins menu on the left. It features an outline of a Minecraft character. This allows you to import a Minecraft Skin.

steps.title: Tap Choose New Skin.
steps.content: Tap Choose New Skin . It's the option at the bottom of the screen. It will open a prompt that allows you to select a custom skin from your photo library.

steps.title: Tap the image of your skin.
steps.content: Tap the image of your skin. It will be an image that resembles the skin you selected but with all the pieces laid out flat instead of in 3D cube shapes.

steps.title: Tap the option that looks best.
steps.content: Tap the option that looks best. Minecraft displays two options for how the skin should be worn. Tap the option that looks best. This selects your custom skin. You can now wear the skin in the game.

steps.title: Open the App Store and tap Search.
steps.content: Open the App Store and tap Search . The App Store has a blue icon with a white capital "A". The Search button is in the lower-right corner.

steps.title: Type Skinseed in the search bar and tap GET.
steps.content: Type Skinseed in the search bar and tap GET . Search Skinseed to see a list of apps that resemble your search result. Locate Skinseed, then tap GET to install the app to your iPhone or iPad.

steps.title: Open Skinseed.
steps.content: Open Skinseed. Skinseed has an icon that resembles a green monster head. Tap the icon on your home screen or tap OPEN in the App Store to open Skinseed. Tap the "X" icon to close any ads that open while using Skinseed.

steps.title: Browse skins.
steps.content: Browse skins. There are a variety of custom skins on the home screen that you can browse. Swipe up and down to browse the different skins. Tap a skin to display it. Alternatively, you can tap the Search tab at the bottom of the screen and use the search bar to search for Minecraft skins by name. Some Minecraft skins in Skinseed come in packs of multiple skins. If you tap a skin pack that displays multiple skins, tap the skin you want to view it.

steps.title: Tap Export.
steps.content: Tap Export . It's below the display of the skin. This displays options for exporting the skin.

steps.title: Tap To Minecraft Pocket Edition.
steps.content: Tap To Minecraft Pocket Edition . This exports an image file of the skin to your photos. You may be asked to allow Skinseed to access your photos. Tap Allow to grant Skinseed access to your photos.

steps.title: Open Minecraft and tap Profile.
steps.content: Open Minecraft and tap Profile . Minecraft on mobile has an icon that resembles a dirt block. Tap the icon on your home screen or apps menu to open Minecraft. After opening the app, tap Profile on the right side of the screen below your Minecraft character. If you're not signed in to your Minecraft account, tap Sign In on the left and sign in with the email address and password associated with your Microsoft or Xbox account.

steps.title: Tap < or > to select a character.
steps.content: Tap < or > to select a character. You have a few different characters to choose from. Tap the arrow icons next to your Minecraft character to select a character.

steps.title: Tap Edit Character.
steps.content: Tap Edit Character . It's the button director below your character. This opens the Character Creator screen, where make your custom skin.

steps.title: Tap the green icon with a hanger.
steps.content: Tap the green icon with a hanger. Look for the third image icon on the left side of the screen and tap it. This displays options for changing your skin and skins that you own.

steps.title: Tap Import.
steps.content: Tap Import . It's the first option at the top of the Minecraft Skins menu on the left. This allows you to import a Minecraft Skin.

steps.title: Tap Choose New Skin.
steps.content: Tap Choose New Skin . It's the option at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap the image of your skin.
steps.content: Tap the image of your skin. It will be an image that resembles the skin you selected but with all the pieces laid out flat instead of in 3D cube shapes.

steps.title: Tap the option that looks best.
steps.content: Tap the option that looks best. Minecraft displays two options for how the skin should be worn. Tap the option that looks best. This selects your skin. You can now wear the skin in the game.

steps.title: Download a skin using a skin downloading app or website.
steps.content: Download a skin using a skin downloading app or website. Head over to the Google Play Store and download an app that lets you download skins, like Skins for Minecraft PE. Navigate the app by searching for a skin you like, selecting it, then downloading it to your device when prompted. Alternatively, head to a website like Skindex and download a skin you like from there. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Download FX File Explorer from the Google Play Store .
steps.content: Download FX File Explorer from the Google Play Store . After downloading your skin, search for FX File Explorer in the search bar and tap the blue and black app with a white FX in the middle. Then, tap Install to install the app on your phone.

steps.title: Open FX File Explorer and click Download.
steps.content: Open FX File Explorer and click Download . Once you open the FX File Explorer, click the brown folder titled Download. It is located in the upper-right corner of the app. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Long tap on the skin file you downloaded and change it from a zip file to mcpack.
steps.content: Long tap on the skin file you downloaded and change it from a zip file to mcpack. The skin that you downloaded earlier should be displayed inside the folder as a .zip file. Long tap on it, get rid of the .zip file, and make sure it ends in .mcpack. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Long tap on the file and open it in Minecraft.
steps.content: Long tap on the file and open it in Minecraft. Once you’ve renamed the file, long tap on it once again, then select Open With. Once different apps pop up, select Minecraft. In the Minecraft app, select Dressing Room , tap the green coat hanger icon, and scroll down to locate and equip your new skin! [9] X Research source
